content.description:
This is the (now) clean splitter system that goes up the left side of the pillar to the left of "Compound Fracture".

 Begin in a left facing corner (same start as the man project) and follow the ramp like system that breaks off to the right.  Follow the ramp to a roof and then up the splitter on hands, cups and fists to an anchor on a small ledge.

 It is possible to clip the first 2 bolts on the route to the left, but for full points go for all gear on the lead.

 One of the better gear warm-ups at the wall.
content.protection:
.3 up to #4 camalot. Extra 1s through 4s.

 A 70 meter rope will get you back down.
content.location: Just inside the canyon on the left.  In between "The Man Project" and "Compound Fracture".

content.description:
A fun short route on steep rock and good holds. The crux is between the third and fourth bolt. 

  NOTE: PLEASE WAIT A DAY OR TWO AFTER A RAIN TO CLIMB!
content.location: This is the fourth route on the South (left) wall of the "Reception" area just below the Doctor's Office proper.

content.description:
Fun new 6-bolt line up corner to a wild, overhanging layback - the crux hits at the 5th bolt. Well-protected and pumpy! May be a bit sandy, as it is a new route. 

  NOTE: PLEASE WAIT A DAY OR TWO AFTER A RAIN TO CLIMB!
content.location: This is the third route on the South (left) wall below the initial scramble up to the Doctor's Office approach.

content.description: This route packs a big punch in its short amount of feet.  Off the deck grab opposing side pull jugs through the first two bolts. Reach a rad no hands kneebar and take a deep breath. Now its time to bang it out.  Move up and left up inspiring small crimps.  Get some air under your feet and fire to the large hole next to the arete.  Dangle and cross, slap around the arete to a good edge.  Continue up the arete.  Don't let the pump get you.  Finish with house calls' like moves.
content.location: first route in the waiting room, left of bp cuff.  Look for the obvious dark streak at the edge of the wall.

content.description: Face climb up huecos and flakes to a series of overlaps, very cool moves. May be a bit sandy, as it is a new route
content.location: This is the second route on the South (left) wall of the "Reception" area, on the level below the Doctor's Office proper.

content.description: Twin thin cracks to start(crux) then long and fun flare to a roof.
content.protection: Gear to 3" Large cam optional. Bolted anchor.
content.location: On the left(north) wall, as you first enter the Reception area. Climbs right side of prominent pillar.

content.description:
The crux is moving past the fixed draw at the 9th bolt. 

  A great climb on cool features,very pumpy, the top may be a bit sandy eary in the season. 

  NOTE: PLEASE WAIT A DAY OR TWO TO CLIMB AFTER A RAIN!!
content.location: This is the fifth route on the South (left) wall of the "Reception" area on the level below the Doctor's Office proper.

content.description:
Face climb to narrow dihedral, then pull roof to anchors. The crux is about halfway up the dihedral. The top may be a bit sandy, as it is a new route. 

  NOTE: PLEASE WAIT A DAY OR TWO AFTER A RAIN TO CLIMB!
content.location: This is the first route on the South (left) side of the "Reception" area - below the initial scramble to gain the Doctor's Office.

content.description:
The Reception Area features a mix of the typical steep sandstone featured face as the canyon narrows. Mostly sport climbs, with a good trad route.

Cody and The Doctor at the Reception area.
